    • Method Detail

      • addFormulas

        public int addFormulas(Node... formulas)
        Description copied from interface: SatProblem

        Adds all given formulas to the problem. First, each given formula is converted to clausal normal form (CNF). Then, each clause of the resulting conjunction is added to the existing conjunction. Ignores clauses already added.

        More formally, let f denote the current (possibly empty) formula in the problem. After this operation, the problem contains the formula f'. f' is the conjunction of f with each of the m ≥ 0 (possibly empty) given formulas gj in CNF:

        f' = f ∧ g1 ∧ … ∧ gm
        Specified by:
        addFormulas in interface SatProblem
        Parameters:
        formulas - formulas to add; not null
        Returns:
        the amount of clauses added

      • addFormulas

        public int addFormulas(java.util.Collection<? extends Node> formulas)
        Description copied from interface: SatProblem

        Adds all given formulas to the problem. First, each given formula is converted to clausal normal form (CNF). Then, each clause of the resulting conjunction is added to the existing conjunction. Ignores clauses already added.

        More formally, let f denote the current (possibly empty) formula in the problem. After this operation, the problem contains the formula f'. f' is the conjunction of f with each of the m ≥ 0 (possibly empty) given formulas gj in CNF:

        f' = f ∧ g1 ∧ … ∧ gm
        Specified by:
        addFormulas in interface SatProblem
        Parameters:
        formulas - formulas to add; not null
        Returns:
        the amount of clauses added

      • addFormula

        public int addFormula(Node formula)
        Description copied from interface: SatProblem

        Adds the given formula to the problem. First, the given formula is converted to clausal normal form (CNF). Then, each clause of the resulting conjunction is added to the existing conjunction. Ignores clauses already added.

        More formally, let f denote the current (possibly empty) formula in the problem. After this operation, the problem contains the formula f'. f' is the conjunction of f with the (possibly empty) given formula g in CNF:

        f' = f ∧ g
        Specified by:
        addFormula in interface SatProblem
        Parameters:
        formula - formula to add; not null
        Returns:
        the amount of clauses added
